title.rendered: Your Guide to Electrical Engineering Internships

content.rendered:
Internships for electrical engineering majors

Behind your favorite products, websites, or even the device you’re reading on right now, there’s an engineering team brainstorming the next latest and greatest. Depending on the field that you’re going into, you could be creating and building a range of products in many different industries.

From electrical engineering internships, you’ll gain skills that range from technical, interpersonal, and problem-solving. Internship opportunities in electrical engineering can foster mastery of applying physics and math to create solutions for energy and electromagnetism.

How do I get an electrical engineering internship?

Getting an internship in electrical engineering could not be more exciting considering the sheer amount of opportunities in different businesses. Electrical engineering internships during summer 2021 will provide you with many valuable experiences, giving a real taste of what it’ll be like to work in electrical engineering down the line. You’ll connect with potential mentors, learn electrical engineering trade secrets, and build relationships with coworkers with a range of expertise. It’s also a plus if it’s a paid electrical engineering internship!

The best electrical engineering internships strengthen resumes, provide valuable avenues to letters of recommendation, and can even turn into full-time jobs. If you consider all of these perks of an electrical engineering internship and add the benefit of exploring different facets of one field, then start your electrical engineering internship search now!

Tips for your resume and profiles

Before you get started on sending out applications, make sure that you have your resume up to date and have fully filled out all your Handshake profile details. With a complete profile, an impressive electrical engineering internship is more attainable than ever. Recruiters are much more likely to message a student with a complete profile that says you want to work in electrical engineering than an unfinished one.

Tips for your internship interview

When you do land your first interview, be it a virtual interview or in person, make sure to come prepared and dressed to impress. Review your resume and cover letter to make sure you have specific examples of your experience to share, from clubs or coursework. You can even schedule a mock interview with your university’s career center or, if you’re tight on time, ask a trusted friend to grill you on some common interview questions.

Tips for networking at your electrical engineering internship

Once you’ve landed an internship in electrical engineering and settled into the flow of day-to-day life at the office, start chatting with your coworkers. Whether they’re industry professionals or fellow interns, it’s important to treat them with equal respect. You never know what insights they could lend, or who could be a valuable connection down the line, five or ten years from now. Don’t be afraid to ask your new colleagues out for quick coffee chats, or request 15-minute informational interviews about their career trajectory.

Want more tips for getting the most out of your electrical engineering internship?

Looking for specific advice for electrical engineering internships for college students? Or are you hungry for further information even after your internship is over? A good way to delve even deeper into your career path growth is to attend a virtual event or two. Not only will you be learning more about your own career, but there will also be chances to network with employers, industry specialists, and other students sharing different perspectives.

Jobs you can get as an electrical engineering major

Wondering where the “electrical engineering internships near me” are? Internships in electrical engineering can fall under any of the following roles we’ve listed here for you! Internships are meant to guide you towards your true desired career path and your summer 2021 electrical engineering internship could kick it off in the right direction. 

For internships, it doesn’t matter if you’re on the hunt for freshman electrical engineering internships or paid business electrical engineering internships or electrical engineering internships in Chicago. The following job roles and suggestions on where to apply for electrical engineering internships can guide you in the right direction for whatever you’re looking for.

What is an electrical engineer?

Electrical engineers research, design, and develop electrical equipment for commercial, industrial, or scientific use. This field requires an electrical engineering degree and in-depth knowledge of the science and function of electrical elements.

Average pay: $66,040

Some companies you can apply to for electrical engineering internships 

  • Lockheed Martin 
  • Phillips
  • Vertiv

Some other roles to consider for your electrical engineering career include: sound engineer, design engineer, IT consultant, and broadcast engineer.

Tips and tricks for your electrical engineering internship

Want tips for getting and acing your electrical engineering internship? Look no further.

How do I get an electrical engineering internship?

When searching for electrical engineering internships, it’s key to use the location filters provided on Handshake. You’ll be able to pinpoint electrical engineering internships exactly where you want to intern just by selecting the city you want in the search bar. Easy electrical engineering internships in your preferred city are just a search away.

You can even research possible job roles that you might want to explore during your electrical engineering internship. Handshake also makes it easy to learn about roles in electrical engineering simply by using the job role search bar.

And if you want to take your research one step further, you can even research top employers in the electrical engineering field on Handshake. Just by using the Handshake employer search feature you can discover companies that are hiring in your specific field by filtering by “Industry.”

Where can I intern for electrical engineering?

Some companies that would be great for electrical engineering majors looking for internships: Lockheed Martin, Phillips, or Vertiv.

Electrical engineering internships can be found all over! Even companies that don’t seem to have a main focus in electrical engineering are looking for bright interns to help them develop.

Are electrical engineering internships paid?

Yes, you can find paid electrical engineering internships on Handshake by using the search filters!

The average annual pay for full time electrical engineering jobs range is $66,040.

How much do electrical engineering interns make?

The average annual pay for full time jobs in electrical engineering is $66,040.

Are internships necessary for electrical engineering majors?

While it’s not required, internships are great opportunities for growth and experience. From software engineer internships to great summer engineering internships, you’ll be able to build both hard and soft skills and even network. 

What do electrical engineering interns do?

Along with networking and gaining mentorship, electrical engineering interns will spend time working on skills great for later in their career journeys. Electrical engineering interns will learn how to plan and execute technical production, communicate their visions effectively, and collaborate with a team on a shared goal.

What companies hire electrical engineering interns?

Some companies that would be great for electrical engineering majors looking for internships: Lockheed Martin, Phillips, and Vertiv.

What can you learn from an electrical engineering internship?

During your electrical engineering internship, you’ll learn some great generic skills like time management, accountability, organization, and teamwork. Additionally, you’ll be immersed in the world of electrical engineering which will help you develop your knowledge of quantitative aptitude, how to manage electrical engineering projects effectively, and about your company’s personal contribution to the industry.

When should I start applying for engineering internships?

There’s no better time to start applying for summer engineering internships or fall engineering internships now! Begin by organizing your application documents and filling out your Handshake profile.

What should electrical engineering interns put on their resume?

When putting together your resume, make sure to have all your skills, courses, and accomplishments laid out for employers to view. Also having your preferred job role and location on your Handshake profile is a great way to signal your interest to potential recruiters.

For electrical engineering interns, some great skills to list would be specific technical skills, time management, ability to follow through and execute, and ability to contribute and collaborate in a team setting. It’s also key to mention organizations or projects that you led and can explain thoroughly. If you’re wondering how to get an electrical engineering internship, start with your resume!
